TopicTitle: What fertilizer do they use in Kerbin to get their trees that big?

Articles.Content:
My mission landed and Bill went out to check out the recoverable debris of my spaceship (I always use parachutes with my stages to have at least some of the parts be in recoverable condition for my ground crews).

Well, while checking the debris I took a look at the horizon and found out that Kerbin trees seem to grow really huge
Are the trees big or are the Kerbals tiny?
Well....you know...with the combination of all the that "landed" less than soft, and all the nuclear engines that have been used/dropped back on to Kerbin......
How tall are Kerbals? Looking at the wreckage, they appear to be 1m tall compared with the engine.

I'm going to get shot for this, but...

Kerbilizer?
I think you're right, I'm sure a dev at one point said they were 1m tall as well. Kerbals are height impaired.

Fun fact: Both explosives and fertilizer tend to have high nitrate content.

In fact, in some places, I think they have to do background checks if you try to buy too much fertilizer at one time.
So rocket fuel is how you should grow plants, we have solved world hunger!
Are the trees big or are the Kerbals tiny?
They sow the ground with a fertilizer made from all of the kerbals we kill in the space program.

I'm going to get shot for this, but...

Kerbilizer?

They sow the ground with a fertilizer made from all of the kerbals we kill in the space program.

It all makes sense now!
If kerbal remains is the fertilizer then there should be a whole lot more trees
It definitely is truely Kerbal, to assume that the trees grow on Rocket fuel and dead Kerbonauts
Trees are not only big, but mobile. When you load a save, they're usually gone.
Nomadic trees? Kerbin has some weird wildlife.

Nomadic trees? Kerbin has some weird wildlife.

They only move when you're not looking. Don't blink...
They send your game version back to 0.10?!?!

[closed]

Edited July 4, 2021 by benjiful9000

-snip-

Kerbilizer?

OOHOHO that's a good one!

Its so funny I'm crying out of laughter!

Hahaha ohhhhoooohoho

Rage097, please do not post only images on the forum. It is stated in section 2.3, subsection a of the rules that "Messages that lack any substantial content, for example messages that contain only reaction images" are frowned upon and are forbidden. You are allowed to post images, just make sure there is some actual content behind them. I have seen you doing similar things as this in other threads, and it would be in the best interest of yourself and the forum if you would please refrain from these types of postings.

If you feel you are uninformed and need to read the rules, or simply can't find them, they're right here.

Thanks!

-M5K
I have to wonder if those crashed nuclear engines had anything to do with accelerated plant growth?

Well, while checking the debris I took a look at the horizon and found out that Kerbin trees seem to grow really huge

I like that debris field, it looks like an art installation. The impression mostly comes from the three mysteriously standing engines and the live Kerbal right next to the stuff (instead of a dead one).

Edited June 2, 2013 by Mephane
Maybe the pollution from the rocket engines released into the atmosphere somehow act as a fertilizer to help the plants grow.

Maybe the pollution from the rocket engines released into the atmosphere somehow act as a fertilizer to help the plants grow.

If that's true, then my space program is 100% environment-friendly. I drove many rovers, landed countless capsules on Kerbin...and i never, ever seen one tree Only those grass-shrubs thingies. Actually i'm excited when i get any ground scatter in KSP. And my settings are at 100% all the time. *sigh* Guess i have to slam more nuke-powered rockets into the planet.

They sow the ground with a fertilizer made from all of the kerbals we kill in the space program.

That's why the grass is green.

Dun, dun, duuuuun!
